description: This file is a FastAPI router module that provides API endpoints for managing a user's library of books. It includes request models, route handlers for listing, adding, retrieving, and removing library entries, and utilizes SQLAlchemy ORM for database interactions.

classes.name: LibraryAddRequest
classes.description: Pydantic model for the request payload to add a book to the user’s library, including book ID and source.

methods.name: Select _query_user_library_base(user_id: str)
methods.description: Builds a base SQLAlchemy select statement for retrieving a user's library with associated book and user data preloaded.

methods.name: Paginated[LibraryRead] list_library( q: Optional[str] = Query(default=None, description="Search across book title and author"), page: int = Query(default=1, ge=1, description="Page number (1-based)"), page_size: int = Query(default=20, ge=1, le=100, description="Items per page"), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), )
methods.description: Handles GET requests to list the current user's library items with optional search and pagination.

methods.name: LibraryRead add_to_library( payload: LibraryAddRequest, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), )
methods.description: Handles POST requests to add a new book to the current user's library, raising errors if the book doesn't exist or is already added.

methods.name: LibraryRead get_library_entry( entry_id: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), )
methods.description: Retrieves a specific library entry by ID for the current user, with validation to ensure ownership.

methods.name: None remove_from_library( entry_id: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), )
methods.description: Removes a library entry by ID for the current user, ensuring the entry exists and belongs to the user.
